item.title: Report X-2024100756
item.description:
Report X-2024100756

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A PACKAGE WITH NO DOT LABEL WAS FOUND RIPPED OPEN. 8X14OZ REGULATED METAL AEROSOL CANS OF JOHNSONS NON-CLORINATED BRAKE AND PARTS CLEANER AEROSOL CAN COVERS BECAME SEPERATED FROM THE CAN , AND THE AEROSOL NOZZLES BECAME CRACKED AND DAMAGED AS A RESULT. THERE IS NO DOT LABEL ON THE ORGINAL PACKAGE AND NO DOT LABEL WAS OBSERVED IN THE SPYDR IMAGE OF THE PACKAGE MAKING THIS PACKAGE UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2024100653
item.description:
Report X-2024100653

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A PACKAGE WITH NO DOT LABEL WAS FOUND WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. 1X1200 FLUID ML REGULATED PLASTIC BOTTLE OF PURELL ADVANCED HAND SANITIZER FOAM WAS FOUND LEAKING DUE TO A FAILED COVER SEAL, CONTENTS LEAKED THOUGH CAP THREADS CONTAMINATING REMAINING ITEMS IN THE PACKAGE. ITEMS IN PACKAGE ARE REGULATED AND THERE WERE NO DOT LABELS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE INDICATING IT SHOULD BE REGULATED MAKING THIS PACKAGE UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report E-2024100278
item.description:
Report E-2024100278

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 1, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of Ancamine 2800 Curing Agent were damaged at the previous terminal and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drums in two (2) 95-gallon drums. ESI personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
